Articles are a great way to start a conversation here. They also express the same opinion as the poster, so he / or she doesn't have to refer back to them later. 
 
 If you won't read the articles here, what makes us think you will read the article via a link. What's the difference? You still need to read the stuff to make an intelligent reply.
 I'm saving you time when I post the article up front. You can either comment on it or not. The only thing in here that DOESN'T deserve a response in here is rudeness. 
 I've been guilty of that. But, people get in bad moods. It happens. When it's consistent...then it's just childish and unproductive

Then why don't you make yourself a little article thread so everyone can be happy. 
 
 :)
I'm not here to make YOU happy

 If you won't read the articles here, what makes us think you will read the article via a link. What's the difference? You still need to read the stuff to make an intelligent reply.
 I'm saving you time when I post the article up front. You can either comment on it or not. The only thing in here that DOESN'T deserve a response in here is rudeness. 
 I've been guilty of that. But, people get in bad moods. It happens. When it's consistent...then it's just childish and unproductive

 
 I agree that articles can be a good conversation starter, but why not kind of sum up what the article is about, then post a link? I like the links better if for nothing else, they take up less space.
